pyntacle.algorithms.key_player module¶

Calculator of key players, as from http://rd.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10588-006-7084-x

class KeyPlayer(graph)[source]¶

Bases: object

[EXPAND]

DF(recalculate=False) → float[source]¶

Calculates the KPP-NEG (equation 9) F = 1 => Maximum fragmentation. All nodes are isolates

Parameters:recalculate (bool) – If True, F is recalculated regardless if it had been already computed
Returns:The DF measure of the graph
DR(index_list, recalculate=False) → float[source]¶

Calculates the distance-weighted reach (equation 14). The distance-weighted reach can be defined as the sum of the reciprocals of distances from the kp-set S to all nodes, where the distance from the set to a node is defined as the minimum distance.

Parameters:
  • recalculate (bool) – If True, distance-weighted reach is recalculated regardless of whether it was already computed
  • index_list (list[int]) – List of node indices belonging to the kp-set
Returns:

The distance-weighted reach measure of the graph
Raises:

WrongArgumentError – When the input node index does not exist
F(recalculate=False) → float[source]¶

Calculates the first version of the KPP-NEG (equation 4) Since nodes within a component are mutually reachable, and since components of a graph can be enumerated extremely efficiently, the F measure (equation 3 of the paper) can be computed more economically by rewriting it in terms of the sizes (sk) of each component (indexed by k). F = 1 => Maximum fragmentation. All nodes are isolate F = 0 => No fragmentation. The graph has one component

Parameters:recalculate (bool) – If True, F is recalculated regardless of whether it had been already computed
Returns:The F measure of the graph
get_graph() → igraph.Graph[source]¶

Returns the graph

Returns:A Graph data structure
mreach(m: int, index_list, recalculate=False) → float[source]¶

Calculates the m-reach (equation 12). The m-reach is defined as a count of the number of unique nodes reached by any member of the kp-set in m links or less.

Parameters:
  • m (int) – Maximum number of links allowed between the kp-set and the other nodes
  • recalculate (bool) – If True, m-reach is recalculated regardless if it had been already computed
  • index_list (list[int]) – List of node indices belonging to the kp-set
Returns:

The m-reach measure of the graph
Raises:

WrongArgumentError – When the input node index does not exist
set_graph(graph, shallow_copy=True)[source]¶

Replaces the internal graph object with a copy of the new in input

Parameters:
  • graph (igraph.Graph) – igraph.Graph object provided in input
  • shallow_copy (bool) – Flag determining shallow or deep copy of attributes of the graph
Raises:

IllegalGraphSizeError – if graph does not contain vertices or edges
